hero.title: Guardian Protocol
hero.subtitle: Traceability & Accountability for AI in Critical Systems

summary.title: Executive Summary
summary.description: Guardian Protocol is a framework for traceability and accountability in AI-based critical systems. When AI makes decisions affecting life or safety - who's responsible? Guardian Protocol ensures every decision traces to named individuals: the developer who coded the rule, the operator who made the call, the commander who authorized the mission. Meets EU AI Act requirements for high-risk AI.
summary.tagline: No fog of war. No 'the system did it.' Just clear accountability.

problem.title: The Challenge: Ukraine, January 2026
problem.scenario: Ukrainian positions faced 500+ hostile drones per day. Autonomous shotgun turrets worked perfectly - 127 drone kills, zero incidents.
problem.adaptation: Then Russia adapted: ground assault instead of drones.
problem.dilemma: The turrets CAN engage ground targets. But they were certified for drones only.
problem.question: Do you authorize mission expansion? Who decides? Who's accountable when autonomous systems are used beyond their designed purpose?

solution.title: The Solution: Graduated Authorization + Individual Accountability
solution.approach: Guardian Protocol provides a framework where every lethal decision traces through a complete accountability chain - from the developer who wrote the code to the commander who authorized the mission.

tiers.title: Standard Operations
tiers.description: Routine operations within certified mission parameters (e.g., anti-drone defense). Autonomous engagement allowed. Standard audit logging.
tiers.example: Confirmed drone <100m → Auto-engage → Standard audit log

tiers.title: Mission Expansion
tiers.description: Operations outside certified parameters (e.g., drone defense → anti-personnel). Requires operator authorization. Enhanced audit automatically triggered.
tiers.example: Ground assault threat → Operator authorizes dire circumstances override → Enhanced audit + command notification

tiers.title: Command Approval
tiers.description: Strategic mission changes require command-level authorization with legal review. Field operators cannot expand mission parameters without higher authority.
tiers.example: Mission creep request → Command evaluates strategic implications → Legal review → Approve or deny

accountability.title: Complete Accountability Chain
accountability.description: Every lethal decision traces to named individuals at each level:

roles: Developer who authored the rule (name, git commit)
Reviewers who approved it (military SME, legal)
Certification authority who signed off (FMV, NATO)
chain.example: Rule #47b: 'Engage armed combatants <100m' → Dr. Andersson (author) → Maj. Bergström (reviewer) → FMV (certifier)

roles: Legal advisor who reviewed rules of engagement
chain.example: System deployed to Sector 4 → Col. Petrov (commander) → Capt. Volkov (assessor) → Lt. Kravchenko (JAG)

roles: Operator who made the decision (authorization timestamp)
chain.example: Dire circumstances override → Capt. Volkov (04:47:34) → 'Ground assault, defensive position at risk' → Col. Petrov notified

accountability.crypto: Every step cryptographically signed. No 'fog of war.' No 'the system did it.'

sectors.title: For NATO/EU Standards Development
sectors.problem: AI Act + NATO standards require 'meaningful human control' for autonomous weapons, but frameworks are abstract.
sectors.solution: Guardian Protocol provides testable, auditable framework: graduated authorization + enhanced audit + individual accountability.
sectors.benefit: Concrete implementation of meaningful human control principle.

sectors.title: For Procurement Authorities
sectors.problem: Autonomous weapons raise accountability questions - who's responsible when system fails?
sectors.solution: Complete audit trail from development (Forge) to operation (Guardian). Every decision traces to named individuals.
sectors.benefit: Clear accountability enables faster procurement decisions.

sectors.title: For Defense Industry
sectors.problem: Developing autonomous weapons without clear accountability framework creates legal/ethical risk.
sectors.solution: Guardian + Forge Protocol provides end-to-end accountability: development provenance + operational audit.
sectors.benefit: Risk reduction, faster certification, NATO compatibility.
